body.p: As a participant in the NHI program, it is my responsibility to:

ul.li: Take my ARV medications every day (or as prescribed by my Doctor).
Use A-Heza, provided by the program, for my child who is also in the program. I understand that I will not sell the A-Heza portion I receive.
Provide up to date and important health information to my doctor.
Not mislead or provide false information to staff or volunteers.
Treat all staff and volunteers of the program with respect.
To attend CNPB at least 10 times a year.
To participate in the Farming and Women Artisan Cooperatives.

If I am unable to complete the above listed participant responsibilities, I understand that I will receive a warning. Two warnings will result in removal from the program and I understand that I will not be able to receive more A-Heza.

body.p: As a participant in the NHI program, I can expect:

ul.li: To have 1 counseling session as I begin the NHI program.
To have 1 counseling session as I complete the program.
To have access to A-Heza each month. After I deliver my child until they are 6 months, I will receive 8Kgs of A-Heza.
From the time my child is 6 months to 18 months of age I will receive 12 Kgs of A-Heza per month for us both.
From the time my child is 18 months to 24 months of age, only my child will receive 8 Kgs of A-Heza each month.
To be told my baby’s nutritional status each monthly meeting (including weight, height and zone of nutrition)
That my HIV status will be kept confidential
To be treated with respect by all TIP staff and volunteers
To have access to TIP staff in the event that I have a concern about the program and my participation
To be able to speak with staff about findings of health indicators assessed during the health assessments and any techniques used to determine those indicators.
